page.title: 19NATURE RESERVE - ABERDYFI
page.content: West of Machynlleth the Afon Dyfi winds its way through sand and mud flats,saltmarsh and creeks on its way to the open sea.This is the{Dyfi {Estuary}one of the finest estuaries of its kind in England and Wales providing a range of natural habitats of outstanding importance. Between the open sea to the west and the hills to the east there are areas of; beach, sand dunes, estuary, sand banks, mudflats and saltings.The most dominant features being the dunes and the estuary which at high tide becomes a sheet of water 7 kilometres long and 2.5 kilometres across at its widest point. Over 2000 hectares of the Dyfi Estuary are a{National Nature Reserve, first established by the{Nature {Conservancy Council}in 1968.
